title: Managing Oxalate Intake
description: Oxalate, better known as oxalic acid, is an organic compound found in many fruits and vegetables. Although it may provide health benefits when consumed in large quantities, it's important to note that high levels of oxalate can guide liver failure. This suggests that some meals, such as spinach, walnuts, and almonds, retain more oxalate than others. So, even though these foods can be healthy, consuming them in moderation is the key to maintaining good health

tips.title: Stay Hydrated
tips.description: Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water daily to help dilute oxalates in your urine.

tips.title: Calcium Intake
tips.description: Pair high-oxalate foods with calcium-rich foods, like yogurt or cheese, to reduce absorption.

tips.title: Portion Control
tips.description: Eat smaller portions of high-oxalate foods occasionally to minimize risks.

tips.title: Regular Monitoring
tips.description: Keep a food diary to track oxalate intake and identify triggers.

tips.title: Consultation
tips.description: Consider consulting a dietitian to receive tailored dietary recommendations that suit your individual needs
